commented_code:
+---
+title: Migrate from @nx-dotnet/core to @nx/dotnet
+description: Step-by-step guide to migrate from the community @nx-dotnet/core plugin to the official @nx/dotnet plugin
+sidebar:
+  label: Migrate from @nx-dotnet/core
+filter: 'type:Guides'
+---
+
+This guide provides a streamlined migration path from the community `@nx-dotnet/core` plugin to Nx's official `@nx/dotnet` plugin.
+
+{% callout type="note" title="Plugin Status" %}
+The `@nx-dotnet/core` plugin is deprecated in favor of the official `@nx/dotnet` plugin (available in Nx 22+), which is maintained by the Nx team and integrated directly into the Nx repository.
+{% /callout %}

discussion_comments.commented_code:

commented_code:
description: 'Graph dependencies affected by changes'
 sidebar:
   hidden: true
+weight: .1
+filter: "type:References"

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -3,6 +3,8 @@ title: 'affected:graph - CLI command'
 description: 'Graph dependencies affected by changes'
 sidebar:
   hidden: true
+weight: .1
+filter: "type:References"
discussion_comments.comment_body: basically made the deprecated items never show up unless you hit the exact title phrase as they were over taking the results. which I think is okay as no reason to really return deprecated commands often.

short docs with exact matching titles soar to the top of the search results. so going for `init` results in this page being at the top. since the `init` generators are called for you automatically with `nx add` not super helpful doc page anyways. so toned it down.

commented_code:
+---
+title: Overview of the Nx Docker Plugin
+description: The Nx Plugin for Docker contains executors and utilities for building and publishing docker images within an Nx workspace.
+keywords: [docker]

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -0,0 +1,64 @@

+title: Overview of the Nx Docker Plugin
+description: The Nx Plugin for Docker contains executors and utilities for building and publishing docker images within an Nx workspace.
+keywords: [docker]
discussion_comments.comment_body:
```suggestion
keywords: [docker]
sidebar:
  label: Introduction
```

this will put 'introduction' as the sidebar title otherwise astro will take the `title` property
